attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We are petitioning the government to increase spending on Higher Education in the UK from the current level of 0.9% of GDP to a level of 1.1%, in order to meet the OECD average. Increasing higher education spending by 0.2% would mean an extra £2.5billion to spend, which could be used to reduce the tuition fees students pay by £1000 every year, or to improve the university experience through funding better facilities or increasing the number of lecturers by 67%

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "increase spending on higher education from the current level of 0.9% of GDP to meet the OECD average of 1.1% of GDP, in order to provide 'World Class Funding' for universities in the UK."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page19786
